title.value: Scalable Operator Allocation for Multi-Robot Assistance: A Restless Bandit Approach
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the top of the paper and in subsequent repeated sections.
title.quote: Scalable Operator Allocation for Multi-Robot Assistance: A Restless Bandit Approach

extractions.description: This paper addresses the challenge of allocating human operators to assist multiple semi-autonomous robots. By modeling the problem as a Restless Multi-Armed Bandit (RMAB) problem and using a Whittle index heuristic, the researchers present a scalable decision support system that optimizes operator allocation in multi-robot systems.

type.justification: The paper offers a theoretical framework and derives conditions for indexability of operator allocation problems using the Restless Bandit approach.
type.quote: In this paper we derive conditions under which the operator allocation problem is indexable, enabling the use of the Whittle index heuristic.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the collaboration between human operators and multiple robots, formulating a method for effective operator allocation among the robots.
name.quote: Advances in robot autonomy have lead to a decrease in the necessity of strict human supervision of robots. This has enabled the development of human-robot collaborative systems where the task is primarily executed by a number of semi-autonomous robots...

name.justification: The research focuses on providing a decision support system that advises human operators on which robots require attention.
name.quote: Therefore, human operators can benefit from having a decision support system (DSS) that advises which robots require attention and when.

name.justification: The paper models the problem as a Markov Decision Process to derive a scalable solution for the operator allocation.
name.quote: It is possible to solve the above problem by modelling it as a Markov Decision Process (MDP).

name.justification: The paper states the use of POMDPs.jl library for implementing the problem and solution frameworks for all policies.
name.quote: The problem and the solution frameworks for all policies were implemented using POMDPs.jl library in Julia.
